intro: Dictyophragmus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Dictyophragmus is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing on rocky soils and cliffs.
